SqlVectorFloat32.summary: Represents the 32-bit float vector datatype in SQL Server.

ctor1.summary: Constructs a null vector of the given length. SQL Server requires vector arguments to specify their length even when null.
ctor1.exception: Vector column length must be non-negative.

ctor2.summary: Constructs a vector with the given values.

Null.summary: Represents a null instance of the type without any attributes.
Null.remarks: This is equivalent to the C# null value.

Length.summary: Returns the number of elements in the vector.

Size.summary: Returns the number of bytes required to represent this vector when communicating with SQL Server.

Values.summary: Returns the vector values as a memory region. No copies are made.
Values.returns: An array of float32 values as value.

ToString.summary: Returns a JSON string representation of the vector. A new string is generated each time you call this method.

ToArray.summary: Returns the vector values as an array of floats.
